old.desc:
From the initial dataset, the most relevant entries for energy consumption analysis are selected and grouped. Seasonal datasets are created to highlight variations across different times of the year. The data is then explored, visualized, and cleaned to remove errors and anomalies. Finally, using the **Short-Time Fourier Transform (STFT)**, the signals are converted into the frequency domain, producing a **clean and structured dataset ready for model training**.

5 story points

listing.name: Story Points for Trello
listing.description:
## <Updates>
### Story Points for Trello (Power-Ups) settings
#### <un-important>
Hello everyone, How are you, we hope everyone and everything will be great. We hope everyone uses Story Points for Trello with minimum bugs, if it's the case we are sorry for your inconvenience but it happens to everything. Nothing can be 100% good, everything has its own cons and pros.

If you are facing any bugs that want to be resolved, Feel free to mail us through mrbluedevelopment@gmail.com.
#### </un-important>

### <Features>
Now we introduced customizable story points sequences. It has its own default sequences; they are Prime Numbers, Fibonacci, Modified Fibonacci and Custom sequence.
In Custom sequence you can add any sequence if you want.

#### <walk-through>
1. Click Power-Ups button from board header
![Picture of Trello Board Header](https://storypoints.netlify.app/static/power-ups-settings/story-points-sequence-settings/trello-board-header.png)
2. Then select Story Points for Trello Power-Up settings
![Picture of Story Points for Trello Power-Up settings](https://storypoints.netlify.app/static/power-ups-settings/story-points-sequence-settings/settings-popup.png)
3. Select "Edit Power-Up Settings"
![Picture of Edit Power-Up Settings](https://storypoints.netlify.app/static/power-ups-settings/story-points-sequence-settings/power-up-setttings.png)
4. Will Open Story Points for Trello Power-Up Settings
![Picture of Story Points for Trello Power-up Settings](https://storypoints.netlify.app/static/power-ups-settings/story-points-sequence-settings/story-points-settings.png)
5. There you can change the Story Points sequence as you wish.

#### </walk-through>

### </Features>
## </Updates>

## About Story Points for Trello
Story Points for Trello are used to assign the weight for a task. Like how the task difficulty level. When story points value increases that means that the task difficulty level also increases. When we assign the story points for each task then we can get the overview of the total work. Then we can make some future predictions, How long will it take to complete all the tasks then we have an estimated release date. And also based on story points and estimated release date we can decide whether we add more resources or should decrease the resources.

 ## How to use it
Story Points for Trello usage is not a big deal, just create a task/card in trello and in the card details page there will be the story points card button and click on that and estimate the story points for that card. Then The estimated story points will display on the card front. And also if you want to check over all estimated story points count of each list. You can access the board button called Story Points then it will list list titles and their total estimated Story Points for each list.

## Pricing
Story Points for Trello are fully free. As of now, We don't charge anything for the usage. All available functionalities are free. There is no trial period.

## Contact
If you have any query or suggestion, always welcome to hear from you. Just get in touch with me via mrbluedevelopment@gmail.com.

## Reference
Whatever we add the description to describe something, the screenshots and demo will make more sense. And also the fastest and easiest way to understand things.

Here, we have attached some screen shots of the Story Points for Trello. How it works and how we can use it.

## 1. Card Badge
![Picture of Card Badge](https://storypoints.netlify.app/static/description/card-badge.png)

## 2. Card Detail Badge
![Picture of Card Detail Badge](https://storypoints.netlify.app/static/description/card-detail-badge.png)

## 3. Card Button
![Picture of Card Button](https://storypoints.netlify.app/static/description/card-button.png)

## 4. Board Button
![Picture of Board Button](https://storypoints.netlify.app/static/description/board-button.png)

## 5. Board Button Popup
![Picture of Board Button Popup](https://storypoints.netlify.app/static/description/board-button-popup.png)

card.desc:
Writing the initial documentation of the Project.

The Documentation must contain:

- team **role distribution**
- **project** description
- draft of the **technical solution** for the project (diagram + additional explanation)
- detailed description of your **research** on the project (with working links)(for example: Are there similar use cases?, explain why you chose this approach, describe its main benefits, challenges, how it can be used, regulations? , etc)
- **Trello** configuration:
  - create a board and share it with the Scrum team & coaches (coaches must be able to log into your board during the presentation)
  - include a link to the board in your document
  - name the board after your project, e.g.,Ergo  Group 1
  - product backlog
  - define lists (+ prepare sprint 1 for January)
  - add tasks and assign deadlines
- link to your GitHub
card.name: Initial Project Documentation

card.desc:

- team **role distribution**

- Trello overview (structure, backlog, sprint introductionweek, set up the sprint for week 1 (January): add tasks and assign deadlines, ...)
